content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s a plain‐language breakdown of what’s going on in this game:

• Genre & Feel
 – It’s a puzzle–action platformer with exploration elements. You control an adventurer (the avatar) who wields a flashing “sword” (shown as a pickaxe) as you navigate maze–like levels. There’s a mix of digging/clearing terrain, collecting resources, and dodging hazards like falling boulders and roaming enemies. The visuals and names (for example, the Spelunky–style avatar and the use of boulders and diamonds) suggest a homage to classic action–puzzle platformers.

• Key Mechanics
 – Moving around a grid–style level made of walls, dirt blocks, and other fixed structures.
 – You have a sword (or pickaxe) that can “flicker” (appear briefly) to remove things like dirt. This lets you open passageways or eliminate obstacles.
 – Diamonds are scattered around as collectibles. Each diamond you pick up raises your score.
 – Boulders fall (acting like missiles constantly moving downward). They bounce off walls and dirt, and if you’re not careful, a boulder falling on you (especially from above) can kill your avatar (and reduce your score).
 – Enemies add another layer of danger. Some (like the “enemy” sprite) move randomly, while others (namely crabs and butterflies) have interactions both with each other and with you. For example, if a butterfly bumps into a crab, it turns that creature into a diamond and gives you extra score.
 – There’s also a door (exitdoor) that represents your ticket out of the level. But interacting with it isn’t automatically safe—the door checks how many diamonds you have (using the “killIfOtherHasMore” rule) before letting you leave.

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions
 – Your goal is to clear the level in a way that the exit door “disappears” (the exitdoor sprite counter reaches zero). This signals that you’ve successfully finished the stage.
 – Meanwhile, if your avatar is killed (for example, by being hit by a falling boulder in a fatal way or other hazards), the game ends in a loss.
 – An interesting twist: The door interaction has a rule related to your collected diamonds. It only lets you successfully exit if you have the proper diamond count (the door “kills” the avatar if it detects the wrong amount—specifically, if you have more than a limit of 9 diamonds). Thus, you must pay attention not only to survival and finding the door but also to managing your resource (diamond) count.

• Overall Strategy
 1. Be cautious of your environment: Navigate safely around walls, dirt, and, critically, falling boulders. Always watch for boulders that might crush you if you’re beneath them, especially since they bounce off obstacles.
 2. Use your sword strategically: It can “flicker” into existence to remove dirt (or maybe weak enemies) and clear paths. It may also be used to defeat obstacles in critical timing.
 3. Manage enemies smartly: Some enemies wander randomly. Others (like crabs and butterflies) can interact with one another in ways that sometimes benefit you (for instance, turning enemies into diamonds). Decide when to fight and when to maneuver around them.
 4. Collect diamonds deliberately: More diamonds yield a score boost, but remember that the exit door’s safety check is tied to your diamond count. Make sure you collect just the right amount (no more than 9) so that when you hit the door, you’re not penalized.
 5. Time your exit: Once you have the correct diamond count, head for the exit door. Understand its rule (“killIfOtherHasMore”) means that if you’ve over–collected, you might not be able to leave. So plan your exploration and resource pickups accordingly.

In a nutshell, you must balance exploration, careful resource collection, and hazard avoidance. Take your time to clear obstacles with your sword while keeping an eye on falling boulders and aggressive or wandering foes. With the right mix of prudent collection (not too many diamonds), savvy movement, and enemy management, you’ll be able to safely reach and use the exit door to complete the level.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background dirt -> '.'
background -> '-'
background exitdoor -> 'e'
background boulder -> 'o'
background diamond -> 'x'
background crab -> 'c'
background butterfly -> 'b'
boulder -> '@'
butterfly -> '#'
crab -> '$'
diamond -> '%'
dirt -> '&'
exitdoor -> '*'
wall -> 'b'
diamond sword -> 'd'

Action:5

I'm moving the avatar upward into an already-cleared space to safely explore further and scout for resources or paths forward, aligning with the overall strategy of cautious exploration.
